ch.aplu.util

Class SliderEntry

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.aplu.util.EntryItem
      • ch.aplu.util.SliderEntry

  • public class SliderEntry
extends EntryItem
    Class derived from EntryItem to create a horizontal slider. IntEntry, LongEntry, DoubleEntry and StringEntry can be mixed up in the same EntryPane.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SliderEntry(int min, int max, int init, int majorSpacing, int minorSpacing)
      Creates a horizontal slider with given properties.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SliderEntry

        public SliderEntry(int min,
           int max,
           int init,
           int majorSpacing,
           int minorSpacing)
        Creates a horizontal slider with given properties.
        Parameters:
        min - the minimum value of the slider
        max - the maximum value of the slider
        init - the initial knob position of the slider
        majorSpacing - the number of values between the major tick marks
        minorSpacing - the number of values between the minor tick marks

    • Method Detail

      • getSlider

        public javax.swing.JSlider getSlider()
        Returns the underlaying JSlider
        Returns:
        the JSlider reference

      • getValue

        public int getValue()
        Returns the current knob position.
        Returns:
        the current value

      • setValue

        public void setValue(int value)
        Sets the current knob position programmatically.
        Parameters:
        value - the new knob position

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean enable)
        Enable/disable the button.

      • isTouched

        public boolean isTouched()
        Returns true, if the slider widget was hit by the mouse until the last call if this method. Any further call will return false, until the button is hit again. Puts calling thread to sleep for 1 millisecond, so it can be used in a tight polling loop.
        Returns:
        true, if the slider was hit since the last call
